title: Bug 116744 - Dynamic text content type has no effect
OB: When setting the Content Type property of a dynamic text element to Auto, Plain, or HTML, the report always displays the same results.
EB:
I expect the report to display different results based on the Content Type property set for the dynamic text element:
- For Plain, I expect the literal content (including tags) to be displayed.
- For Auto, I expect content 1, content 2, and content 3 to appear properly without any HTML or RTF tags.
- For HTML, I expect content 1 and content 2 to appear properly without HTML tags, and content 3 to appear literally with RTF tags.
SR:
1. Open the attached report.
2. Navigate to the dynamic text element's Content Type property.
3. Set the Content Type property to Plain.
4. Verify that the report displays the literal content with all tags.
5. Set the Content Type property to Auto.
6. Verify that the report displays content 1, content 2, and content 3 properly without any HTML or RTF tags.
7. Set the Content Type property to HTML.
8. Verify that the report displays content 1 and content 2 properly without HTML tags, and content 3 literally with RTF tags.
